chapter.title: ⪪ Installation
chapter.para: Since version 12 SP1, ⪪ is included in &sls;. To install it, start &sls; 12 SP1 installation, and click Software on the Installation Settings screen. Then select the Subscription Management Tool pattern on the Software Selection and System Tasks screen, and confirm with OK.

tip.title: Installing ⪪ on an Already Installed System
tip.para: If you already have &sls; 12 SP1 installed and want to install ⪪ additionally, follow the same procedure, but instead of including the ⪪ pattern from the installation screen, simply run &yast;SoftwareSoftware Management, select ViewPatterns and select the ⪪ pattern there.

chapter.para: Because ⪪ depends on other software products, such as MariaDB database engine or Apache Web-server, a number of packages is automatically selected for installation.

It is recommended to check for ⪪ updates available immediately after installing &sls;. &suse; continuously releases maintenance updates for ⪪, and newer packages are likely to be available compared to those installed from media, for example using the zypper patch command.
After the system is installed and updated, do a first-time ⪪ configuration with &yast;Network Services⪪ Configuration Wizard.

sect1.title: ⪪ Configuration Wizard
sect1.para: The two-step ⪪ Configuration Wizard helps you configure ⪪ after &sls; installation is finished. You can then change the configuration later using the &yast; ⪪ Server Configuration module—see .

step.para: The Enable Subscription Management Tool service (⪪) option is checked by default. Uncheck it only if you want to disable the ⪪ product.
If the firewall is enabled, check Open Port in Firewall to allow access to the ⪪ service from remote computers.

Enter your &scc; organization credentials in User and Password. If you do not know your &scc; credentials, refer to . Test the entered credentials by pressing the Test button. ⪪ will connect to the Customer Center server using the provided credentials and download some testing data.
Enter the e-mail address you have used for the &scc; registration into SCC E-mail Used for Registration.
Your ⪪ Server URL should contain the URL of the ⪪ server being configured. It is populated automatically.
Press Next to continue to the second configuration step.
For security reasons, ⪪ requires a separate user to connect to the database. With the Database Password for smt User widget set the database password for that user. Confirm it in the following field.
Enter all e-mail addresses that ⪪ should send reports to using the Add button. You are also able to Edit or Delete any incorrect or obsolete addresses.
If the current database root password is empty—as in any freshly installed system—you will be asked to enter it.

⪪ defaults to communicate with the client hosts via a secure protocol. To use the secured https protocol, the ⪪ server needs to have a server SSL certificate. If it is not created yet, the wizard warns you and offers its creation with Run CA Management. Refer to for detailed information to manage certificates with &yast;.

sect1.title: Upgrading from Previous Versions of ⪪
sect1.para: This section contains the information about upgrading ⪪ from the previous versions.

important.title: Upgrade from Versions prior to 11 SP3
important.para: Direct upgrade path from ⪪ prior to the version 11 SP3 is not supported. You need to upgrade the operating system to &sls; 11 SP3 or SP4 as described in , and at the same upgrade ⪪ to version 11 SP3 as described in . Then follow the steps described in .

sect2.title: Upgrade from ⪪ 11 SP3
sect2.para: To upgrade ⪪ from version 11 SP3 to 12 SP1, follow these steps:

step.para: Backup and migrate the database. See the general procedure in .
If you have not already done so, migrate from Novell Customer Center to &scc; as described in .
Upgrade to &sls; 12 SP1 as described in .
Look if the new /etc/my.conf.rpmnew exists and update it with any custom changes you need. Then copy it over the existing /etc/my.conf:
Enable the smt target to start at the system boot.

sect3.title: Migration to &scc; on ⪪ 11 SP3
sect3.para: ⪪ now registers against &scc; instead of Novell Customer Center. Therefore you need to switch the registration center on &sls; 11 before upgrading to &sls; 12. You can switch to &scc; either via a &yast; module or command-line tools.

Before performing the switch between customer centers, make sure that the target customer center serves all products that are registered against ⪪. Both &yast; and the command-line tools perform a check to find out whether all products can be served with the new registration server.

The migration itself is time-consuming and during the migration process the ⪪ server may not be able to serve clients that are already registered.
The migration process itself changes the registration server and the proper type of API in the configuration files. No further (configuration) changes are needed on the ⪪.
To migrate from &ncc; to &scc; via &yast;, use the &yast; smt-server module.

sect1.title: Enabling SLP Announcements
sect1.para: ⪪ already includes the SLP service description file (/etc/slp.reg.d/smt.reg). In order to enable SLP announcements of the ⪪ service, open respective ports in your firewall and enable the SLP service.
